data.text:
I need help with planning my Social Security survivor benefits.
Do you need information about planning for your future Social Security survivor benefits?
Yes.

What would my widower receive in benefits?
In the event of your passing, your widower would start receiving reduced benefits at age 60 or full benefits if they are at retirement age or older.

I want to make sure that my family is financially taken care of after my passing. How do Social Security survivor benefits work?
Your Social Security can help ensure that your family is taken care of if you have earned enough credits through working.

How do I apply for disability benefits?
I can help you with that. First off, you should apply for benefits as soon as you become disabled.
Are you interested in applying now?
No, I don't think I am ready.
Ok, no problem. Are you deaf or hard of hearing?
Oh, no. I am not.
Do you have access to a telephone?
I do.

Do you have any documents or publications that I can read?
We do, what are you interested in? Applying online for disability benefits? We also have documents on disability benefits and a starter kit.

What documents do I need to get a corrected Social Security Card?
Citizenship is one option.
Have you established yourself as American citizen with us?
No, I don't think that I have.

Can I use my US passport as proof of both being a citizen and my identity?
Yes you can.

Ok, I see what you mean by citizenship. A passport proves that?
Yes, it does.
Do you need to change your name on your Social Security Card?
Not right now, but I might in the future. I am getting married next year.
If I had changed my name what document would I need?
Any unexpired identity document in your new name, as long as we can find in our records your previous identity.

Is a passport ok?
Yes it is.

I need a corrected ss card for an adult
Do you need to egally change your name because of marriage , divorce , court order or any other reason
no
are you working?
N/A
Has your name changed?
yes
If you do not tell us when your name changes it could  Prevent your wages from being posted correctly to your Social Security record

What documents do I need as proof of identity?
U.S. driver 's license or State - issued non - driver identification card

will this cuase a delay when I file taxes?
it may which may lower the amount of your future Social Security benefits  and Cause delays when you file your taxes
I need help with the retirement benefits planner

I need help with replacement card for a noncitizen adult.
You can replace your Social Security card for free if it is lost or stolen; but you may also not need to replace your Social Security card.
Do you not have permission to work but need a Social Security number for other purposes?
No I do not need the Social Security number for other purposes.

I need a replacement card for a foreign born Us adult
You can replace your Social Security card for free if it is lost or stolen
Ok great! Do you have to be of a certain age to apply?
If you are age 18 or older with a U.S. mailing address and have amySocial Securityaccount
For more information about creating my Social Security account and getting a replacement card online
Ok awesome! thank you
IS there a limit of replacement cards  i can get a year?
You are limited to three 3 replacement cards in a year and 10 during your lifetime

hello, hope you are well. How do I get an original card for a foreign Born Us citizen?
Hello! I hope you are well too. I will be glad to help you with that. one moment please while I check...You must present original documents or copies certified by the agency that issued them .
DOes this apply to you or a member of you r family?
yes it does.
If you want to claim your child for tax purposes while the adoption is still pending  contact the Internal Revenue Service for Form W-7A , Application for Taxpayer Identification Number for Pending
Where can I get more information?
For more information, see Social Security Numbers For Children (Publication No.   [16] 05-10023)

Good morning. I'm parent of a foreign born U.S citizen child and need to get her a SSN card, could you tell me about it?
No problem. To do that, you'll need to prove first the child's citizenship, so you'll have to present some documents, such as certification of report of birth, consular report of birth abroad or U.S passport.
I assume you don't have any of these documents?
No, i don't, no.
Oh, hey, i was wondering if it is possible to present other documents as proof?
Sure. In that case, just certain documents are accepted, and these should have child's name, date of birth or age, and a recent photograph, to be acceptable.

So, those would be helpful to get that SSN card, isn't?
That's correct. Be aware though that any document you present must be originals or copies certified by the agency that issued them. Of course, must be unexpired too.

tell me more about my Social Security benefits
Are you retired?
yes
Are you disabled?
yes I am
Did you want to know how Social Security can provide your family with benefits when you die?
that could help
Social Security can provide your spouse and other eligible members of your family with benefits when you die.

is there a way to look at what more or less we can get from these benefits?
You can use one of our benefit calculators to estimate your future retirement, disability, and survivors benefits

Could you please give me some information about survivors' benefits?
We do have a survivors planner that you can use to see what best suits your particular situation.

What can I do if I do not have enough Social Security credits to qualify for benefits?
You can use one of our benefit calculators to estimate your future retirement, disability, and survivors benefits if you want an estimate.

If I have never worked, can I still qualify for spousal benefits?
You may still qualify for benefits if you are the spouse or divorced spouse of a retired worker even if you have never worked.
Am I eligible for benefits based on my ex-spouse?
Even if you never worked under Social Security, you may still qualify for benefits if you are the spouse or divorced spouse of a retired worker.
Can you help me out with the benefits planner for retirement?

Do you need to learn about the government pension offset or GPO?
No, that is not what I need to know.

Do you need info to calculate your benefits if they are affected by the GPO?
No, I do not need info to calculate benefits affected by GPO.

Would you need to know if you will be eligible for spouses benefits and have access to your spouse's estimate?
Yes, I need to know if I would be eligible for spouses benefits and have access to estimate.
Do you know how to find the estimate amount of the retirement benefit your spouse would be eligible to receive at full retirement age?
No, I do not know how to find the estimated amount.
Do you know you would have to divide the amount in half and round down to the nearest dollar?
Yes, I know what I need to do math wise .
Then your estimated monthly amount of your Social Security benefit as a spouse, widow, or widower before the effect of GPO would be what you need to know.
Could you help me with the Retirement Benefits Planner?

Would you like to know about Government Pension Offset pertaining to retirement?
Yes, I would like to learn about GPO.
Will you receive a pension for work not covered by Social Security such as government employment?
Yes, I will receive a pension for work not covered by Social Security.
Then any Social Security you would receive on your spouse's record may be reduced.

Could I get access to my spouse's estimates of benefits?
Did you find the amount of the retirement benefit your spouse would be eligible to receive at full retirement age?
No, I did not find that amount yet.
Did you know that you need to divide the amount your spouse gets in half and round down to the nearest dollar?
Yes, I am aware of the calculations I have to do.
Then you should be able to find the amount of estimated monthly Social Security benefit you would receive as a spouse.

What age should I start my benefits?
Sure I can help you with that information
The answer is that there is no one " best age " for everyone and , ultimately , it is your choice

DoI need to sign up for medicare?
Please read the general and special enrollment period information on page 12 of our Medicare booklet to find out what may happen if you delay

What if my parents didnt grow up in the 1980's, should I still apply?
you may choose to start receiving retirement benefits earlie
Is there a best age to get benefits?
The answer is that there is no one " best age " for everyone and , ultimately , it is your choice

Could you please help me? I need to find out how to get an replacement card for a non citizen child that I have in my care.
You can replace your child's Social Security card free if it is lost or stolen. You are limited to three replacement cards in a year and 10 in a lifetime. Legal name changes and other exception do not count toward these limits.
For what purpose does your child need a Social Security number, is he/she permitted to work?
My child does not have permission to work.
What other exceptions don't count towards the limit to the number of replacement cards that can be issued?
Changes such as immigration status that require card updates may not count toward the limit.

Hello I need information about What happens after I apply for retirement benefits?
Once we receive your request, we will review it. After the review, we will contact you if we need more information or if we need to see your documents.
and after the review?
We will contact you if we need more information or if we need to see your documents.
Is it possible that I may receive benefits on someone else's record?
We will gladly let you know this after reviewing

For what reasons does Social Security provide people with benefits?
Do you have a wife and children?
I do.
Social Security can provide you, your spouse, and other eligible members of your family with benefits when you retire and on other occasions.
I am preparing for retirement.  Can you tell me what I would need to know beforehand?
I can, but are you in any way disabled?
I am not.  I am simply preparing to retire from the workforce.
Ok, if you are not disabled and are not retiring right now, we do not need to do any processing at this moment.
Are there any tools that I could use to prepare for coming out of the workforce?
You can use our planners to help you to better understand your Social Security protection as you plan for your financial future.  Then you can choose a benefit calculator to get estimates of benefits you and your family may be eligible for.

What will the benefits planner used for?
Do you want to get Social Security benefits for you, your spouse, or your family.
Yes, I would like to apply.
Do you know you can get Social Security benefits when you retire?
Yes, I know this.
Are you disabled?
No, I am not.
Then you wouldn't be able to get Social Security disability for you, your spouse, or eligible family.

Are there any online tools available for me estimate calculations?
Yes, we have a few benefits calculators online to help you plan.
What kind of retirement benefits do I need?

Are you retired?
No I am not yet retired.

Can you apply online?
Yes I can

Who can apply for benefits?
You can apply online for retirement benefits or benefits as a spouse if you are at least 61 years and 8 months old

What if I am having an issue with it
you can find additional information in our [ More Info ] links

I have not applied for retiremtn can I still apply?
You can apply online for retirement benefits or benefits as a spouse if you

Will my children get benefits as well?
Are you or a spouse on disability?
yes we both are.
ok no problem. Thanks for the response your children may also qualify to receive benefits on your record

How old do they need to be? My spouse that is
your ex - spouse must be at least 62 years old

Are there any books or pages i can read about this?
please refer to  Disability Benefits article

ok thanks
the child must be unmarried

Will I be eligible for spouse's benefits and have access to my spouse's benefits?
Do you want to find the estimated amount of the retirement benefit you spouse would get at full retirement?
Yes, that is what I would like to know.
Then the  estimated monthly amount of you Social Security amount as a spouse, widow, or widower before the effect of GPO is what you need to look at.

What if I will be eligible for widow's benefits or I do not have access to my spouse's estimates?
You could call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or if you are hard of hearing at 1-800-325-0778 or just contact your local Social Security office.

What happens if I retire before full retirement age?
Your benefit amount as a spouse would be reduced and would vary based on your birth date.
Do you need to find out more info about estimated benefit amount if you retire before reaching full retirement age?
Yes, I need to find out more info about my estimated benefit amount if I retire before full retirement age.
Call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or at 1-800-325-0778 if hard of hearing or your local office.

I'm applying for retirement benefits and want to know how much my wife would get.
I can help you figure this out. Are you looking for the estimated amount that she would receive at full retirement age?
No, she already receives her own benefits.
Okay. Would you like me to help you calculate her benefit?
No, I just found out how to do it online. Just divide the amount and round down to the nearest dollar.
Be advised that this amount would be different if you are affected by the GPO.

Okay. How can I find more information about my benefit amount if I choose to retire before full retirement age?
You can always call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or contact your local Social Security office for more information.
Will they be able to help me calculate my own benefits?

Hi, how you doing. Look, i'm looking for information about what original documents do i need related to replacing a SSN card for a child, please?
Yes, no problem. The documents you need will serve to prove child's U.S citizenship. There is only certain documents that we can accept in that regard.
Have you already established the child's U.S citizenship with us?
No, i hadn't do that.

That got me thinking. Please, that card can be replaced, isn't?
Sure, sure. The child's SSN card can be replaced free of charge in case is lost or stolen. you should know that you have a limit for that operation, up to 3 times in a year and up to 10 times during your lifetime.
Oh, i didn't knew that. Look, can i present copies of the documents?
That's not possible, sorry. Those documents you should present, must be original or if they are copies, must be certified by that agency that issued them. We won't accept notarized copies, either. Of course, these documents mus be current and not expired.

Uh, mus take that into account. And, in any case, i could present other documents to you?
It is possible, yes. Any document presented must show your name, date of birth or age, and a recent photograph. This document could be, for example, a employee identification card.
Oh, oh, another question please. Could you tell me with what purposes you use a document?
Well, that would depend on the document presented, but for example we could use your U.S passport as proof of both citizenship and identity.
Ok. um, lets say i don't have a document available to present, do i have any options regarding that?
Yes, you have an option. We may accept some other document, such as a state issued non driver identification card or, in case your child is adopted, a adoption decree.
Hello, I wwas wondering where I begin?

Hope all is well. Are you at retirement age?
Yes I am
Are you retired?
no i am not
Is there a best age to start?
The answer is that there is no one " best age " for everyone and , ultimately , it is your choice
If I expect to live long will i get more?
you may want to delay starting your benefits until full retirement age or later
Hey there. Please, i,ve been searching info about retirement and want to know about estimates.

No problem. Would you like to know about the retirement estimator?
No, i already heard how that works.

All right. Would you like to know If you can use the retirement estimator, then?
No, neither that, i saw a video the other day about it.

Understood. Well, Do you need assistance with something on the online application?
Yes, that's it. I'm having certain doubts there.
Perfect. Are you having security issues?
Yeah, i having some problems with that. You'll see, after some time in a page, a pop up appears asking me if i want to extend my time there, what could be that?

Hi there. I would like to get some information related on disability benefits.
Sure, no problem, we are here to help you to learn about your benefits, and any other doubt you may have.
have you already received any social security benefit before?
Yes, I have already receive some of this benefits.
Great. So we can just give you information as well as help you to manage your benefits online.

This can be done from home?
Yes, you can. Through the online process from any computer.

Great. To do this, do I have to give any more documents?
Yes, we can ask you for some few documents, such as your birth certificate. Do you have one with you?
Not right now. I'll have to ask for one.
You will need it for sure, if you don't have it, then we can proceed.

I would like to have information on social disability benefits management
must know disability benefits
ok but how do I manage them if I already receive Social Security disability benefits?
You can get information and services to manage your benefits online.

I understand and what other forms can I apply?
you can apply various methods over the phone or in person

Can you help me with the family benefits planner?
Do you receive disability benefits?
Yes, I receive disability benefits.
Certain family members may qualify for benefits on your record such as your spouse.

How long does my ex-spouse have to married to me to receive benefits under my record?
Your ex-spouse will receive benefits if you were married at least 10 years and has to be 62 years old.

Who directly receives family benefits from my record?
Certain family members like your spouse will receive benefits from your record.

Will my spouse receive retirement benefits under my record even if they recieve them under their own record?
We will always pay your spouses benefits under their own record first; but will pay the higher amount combined with your benefit.

How long does my ex-spouse have to be married to me to receive benefits from my reocrd?
Your ex-spouse would have needed to be married to you for at least ten years.

I need help with the benefits planner for family.
Did you start receiving benefits?
No I have not received benefits.

How do my children receive benefits?
The child must be unmarried.
what children are eligible on my record to receive benefits?
Your eligible children can be biological, stepchild, or adopted, and possibly grandchild.

You can help me with my family benefits and who can get some benefits
Do you want to know which members of your family may qualify for benefits on your record when you start receiving disability benefits?
yeah, like wife and kids
Some members of your family may qualify for benefits on your record .Benefits may be paid to your spouse and others

But what about my kids or stepkids?
They might also qualify to receive benefits on your record .Your eligible child can be your biological child , adopted child , or stepchild .  Even a A dependent grandchild may qualify .

Can my ex I left in a divorce qualify on my record?
Ex - spouses may qualify for benefits on your record , even if you have remarried.

What happens with my wife and our current benefits?
If your wife is eligible for retirement benefits on her own record ,we will pay that amount first .But if the spouse benefit that is payable on your record is a higher amount ,he or she will get a combination of benefits that equals that higher amount .

Can my family receive my benefits as well?
Yes, your family can receive benefits when start receiving your own benefits. Are you receiving yours yet?
Yes, I am currently receiving disability benefits.
Then certain members of your family, such as spouses, may qualify for benefits on your record.

Are there any publications concerning disability benefits?
Yes, these publications are titled "Disability Benefits", "Benefits For Children", and "What You Need To Know When You Get Social Security Disability Benefits."

Is there a maximum amount that a family member can receive in benefits?
Yes, there is a limit to how much each family can receive.
Is the sum of your benefits payable on your account greater than the family limit?
No, that is not correct.

Oh, hi. Please, i'm looking for some info about family benefits. could you help me out?
Are you currently receiving any disability benefits?
Yeah, i started to receive it recently.
Well, in that case, i can tell you that some members of your family may also qualify to get benefits on your record.

That sounds good. Say, do you know how much could be the total amount perceived?
That depend on the factor of how many family members get qualified on your record, aside from the amount of your benefit. For that reason, final amount can vary, but mostly it reaches between 150 to 180 percent of your disability benefit.
Oh, that sounds great, really sweet. do you know an estimate of how much each family member could receive?
In that regard, each member can get, if qualify, up to 50 percent of your disability benefit. Of course, in this cases as in many others, there is a limit which we cannot cross and so your family receive certain up to certain amount.

Um, it makes sense, of course. Look, what about if my spouse was on Social Security too?
Are you spouse about to get retirement?
Yeah, my spouse is waiting for that.
Perfect. In that case, your spouse will receive its amount first. However, if your spouse benefit on your record is higher, then your spouse may receive a mix of benefits that would equal the higher amount.

I have questions about family benefits.
Are you receiving benefits?
Yes, I have disability benefits.
Then certain members of your family may also qualify for benefits.

How long will my child get benefits?
Until they graduate high school or 2 months after they turn 19, whichever comes first.
Does it have to be my biological child?
Your child can be biological, adopted, or stepchild.

Can my spouse apply?
Yes, but we may need proof of marriage.

What if my spouse worked, too?
We pay them their benefits first, and if yours is higher, we add the difference between the two.

Can you help me with family benefits?
Have you started getting disability benefits?
Yes, I just did.
Certain family members can qualify for benefits.

How long does my spouse get benefits?
Your spouse gets benefits until the child turns 16, then the child's continue but your spouse;s stop.

Does it matter if my spouse worked, too?
Is your spouse eligible for benefits on their own record?
Yes, she is eligible on her own.
She will get her amount first, then if your benefit is higher, we add the difference.
So she gets the higher amount?
Yes, we make sure she will receive her maximum possible benefit.

So when our child turns 16, my spouse's benefits stop?
Yes, unless your spouse is eligible to receive retirement or widow benefits.

I need help understanding family benefits.
You've already started receiving disability benefits?
Yes, I get benefits.
Certain family members may qualify for benefits on your record.

What children qualify?
Biological, adopted, and stepchildren are all eligible.

Is my spouse old enough to be eligible?
If they are 62 or older, they qualify.

How much can they receive?
Eligible family members can receive up to 50% of your disability amount.

Hi there. Went the other day to social security asking for family benefits and they told me to use this chat, can you help me?
Are you going to start receiving disability benefits?
Yeah, i will.
Congrats. If you are going to start receiving benefits, then some members of your family can qualify for benefits based on your record.
Could you tell me which members could be eligible, please?
Sure. These benefits could be paid to your spouse, divorced spouse or children, regardless their condition.

That's great, thanks. Say, what could happen if my spouse is about to receive a pension for work not covered by social security?
If that scenario appears, i'm afraid her benefit on your record may be affected.

Something to think about, huh?. Please, another question. what can you tell me about my children's benefits?
You said you already qualified for disability benefits, isn't?
Yes, that's what i said.
Good. Then your children may also get a qualification to receive benefits on your record. It can go for your biological, adopted or step child. Even a grandchild could qualify.

Does everyone in my family get the benefits?
certain members of your family may also qualify for benefits on your record
oh ok there is  no one else besides me and my boyfriend but thank you

Do benefits for you child ever stop?
18 or older and have a disability that started before age 22

What proof will you ask for?
we may also ask for proof of marriage and dates of prior marriages , if applicable

IS there a family limit?
If the sum of the benefits payable on your account is greater than the family limit ,  the benefits to the family members will be reduced proportionately .s   Your benefit will not be affected

I need to know if I can apply for adult disability benefits online.
It is possible to apply online, if you meet our requirements.

Okay. Is it better to apply online instead of using other methods?
Yes. There are many advantages to applying online.

What documents will I need to provide?
First you will need to provide your birth certificate. Do you have one?
Yes. I do.
Excellent. Were you born in the United States?
No, but I have proof of U.S. citizenship.
Okay. Since you already have proof of U.S. citizenship, you won't need any further proofs of identity.

what kinds of proof will I need when I apply for disability?
Did you want to know what documents we may ask you to provide?
yes
Do you have a birth certificate or other proof of birth?
I have a birth certificate
Do you have proof of U.S. citizenship or lawful alien status?
yes, I'm American
Do you have your U.S. military discharge paper if you had military service before 1968?
no, don't have those
I'm sorry but you don't have the documents needed to show that you are eligible for Disability Benefits.

What are the next steps if I do not qualify for benefits on someone else's record?
Even if you do not qualify on someone else's record some members of your family could get benefits under your record.

Could I get benefits as a spouse?
Yes, if you have never worked under Social Security, you could get spouse's retirement benefits as long as you are 62 years of age or older and your spouse is all ready receiving retirement or disability benefits.

What happens if my spouse is all ready receiving benefits when I apply?
If you spouse and you apply at the same time or spouse is receiving benefits all ready, then we will automatically check your eligibility for benefits as a spouse.

Is there a maximum a family can get in benefits?
Yes, and the total depends on your spouse's benefits amount and the number of family members who would qualify on the same record; but generally the total amount the your spouse and family members can receive is about 150 to 180 percent of the worker's full retirement benefit.

hi
hi

hi

hi

hi
hi

How do I apply for Social Security Retirement?
There are a few different ways you can apply for Social Security Retirement.

What if I am divorced, could I get divorced spouse benefits?
You should read "If You Are Divorced" to learn about divorced spouse benefits.

How would someone from my family qualify for benefits when I do not?
Would you like to find out about information for your family?
Yes, I would like to find out more info for my family benefits.
Then you should go to the section that states "Benefits For Your Family" to find out what you need to know.

What if my spouse is all ready receiving benefits when I apply?
We would also check your spouses eligibility for benefits as a spouse and if qualify the application would automatically be a request for spousal benefits.

Regarding retirement benefits, how do I apply?
you can apply different application formats
ok but if my spouse is already receiving benefits when I submit the application
If you and your spouse apply at the same time, we will also verify your eligibility for spouse benefits. and if you qualify your application will automatically serve as a request for spousal benefits
and if you do not live in the US or in one of its territories?
In that case, you can also contact the Social Security office, the US embassy or consulate.

Hello I need information about What original documents do I need to get a Social Security Card?
Among the documents you will need are those of your citizenship
Have you been informed about the child's U.S. citizenship?
no no and informed
and what documents will they need?
we must see proof of their identity. An acceptable document must be current, not expired and show your name, information identifying your date of birth or age, and preferably a recent photograph.

And is there also something important that I must present?
It is important that you present original documents or copies certified by the agency that issued them.

And in my case, what proof of identity should I present?
Among the documents is the United States Driver's License
Hello where do I begin?

are you talking about delayed retirement credits?
yes
Social Security retirement benefits are increased by a certain percentage depending on date of birth if you delay your retirement beyond full retirement age

Have you reached full retirement age?
ok thank you
what if you reached retirement age?
Does the person get to decide to delay retirement?
yes
what if i reached full retiremtnt age?
you can choose to start receiving benefits before the month you apply
I want to know what comes next after I'm approved for disability benefits

Do you want to know when your benefits start?
yes sir
And your application has already been approved?
it was
Okay, so your first Social Security benefit will be paid for the sixth full month after the date that your disability began. For example ,if your disability began on June 15 , 2018 , your first benefit would be paid for the month of December 2018 , the sixth full month of disability .

what if I need more help and can I ask for Medicare too to help with inpatient costs?
You will be automatically enrolled in Medicare after you get disability benefits for two years. The two parts of Medicare we enroll you in are hospital insurance and medical insurance .Hospital insurance Part A helps pay for inpatient hospital bills and some follow - up care .

is there more info that you can give me about other benefits and how it could affect my disability I was approved for?
Yes, you can look at some publications. Such as, How Workers ' Compensation And Other Disability Payments May Affect Your Benefit or Windfall Elimination Provision

can you tell me how much I will be getting per month?
The amount of your monthly disability benefit is based on your lifetime average earnings covered by Social Security . You can get an idea by logging into your personal my Social Security account or use our Benefit Calculators to find out how much you would be receiving.

What happens after I report a death?
Are you receiving benefits on your spouse's record?
Yes, but he passed away.
We automatically change your monthly benefits to survivors benefits when we get a report of the death.

How can I report the death?
We have phone representatives available or you can visit your local office.

Do I have to have all the paperwork ready to apply?
You can still apply without having all the paperwork.

If I'm not already getting benefits, do I need to apply?
You need to apply for survivors benefits immediately.

How much will I receive for disablilty
he amount of your benefit is based on your lifetime average earnings covered by Social Security
Do you already have an estimate?
I don't already have an estimate
you can get your online with your personal my Social Security account or use our Benefit Calculators to determine

do I qualify for exrea help with medicare prescription plan
If you receive Medicare and have limited resources and income ,

When do my benefits start?
Social Security benefits are paid in the month following the month for which they 're due

Who do I contact for help with low income medicare nenficiaries?
contact your state or local welfare office or Medicaid agency

My application for benefits has been approved but I have not received any benefits yet. Can you tell me when my benefits will be paid?
You say your application was approved, can you tell me the date of the approval?
It was approved early this month.

Am I eligible for further Medicare benefits?
You might be eligible for Extra Help with Prescription Drug Plan Costs.

When will my first benefit payment be?
Your first benefit payment will be paid for the sixth full month after the date that your disability began.

Can I received Medicare benefits from a private company?
If you receive Medicare Parts A and B you can choose to receive all your health care services through plans that are offered by private companies that are approved by Medicare.
Do you need further information about Medicare?
Yes could you please give me further information.
I recommend that you read Medicare's page.

Hi, good morning. I'm looking to do some benefits planning on disability. Can you help me with that?

So can you tell me what will change, now that I earn more?
You'll pay a larger percentage of the total cost of Part B based on the income you normally report to the Internal Revenue Service IRS. You'll pay monthly Part B premiums equal to 35, 50, 65, 80, or 85 percent of the total cost, depending on what you report to the IRS.

I see. So how exactly do you determine my income-related adjustment amounts?

So if I had less income, what would I need to do? My wife has that issue currently.
In that case we need to see documentation verifying the event and the reduction in your income. The documentation you provide should relate to the event and may include a death certificate, a letter from your employer about your retirement, or something similar.

Does this mean I could get disability benefits?
Yes, you may be able to get disability benefits if you've had surgery or received other treatment at a VA hospital, approved hospital, or outpatient center for a disability related to your military service called a service-connected disability.
Is it enough that I had surgery?
In this case, the surgery required a recovery time of at least one month or reports show that the surgery or treatment was for a service-connected disability.
What if my surgery didn't go well and cause severe problems?
If the surgery resulted in severe issues, like surgical wounds that haven't totally healed, and the surgery required a recovery time of at least one month or reports show that the surgery or treatment was for a service-connected disability, then you qualify.
